alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 6:07PM MST until March 16 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Cornville affecting Yavapai County. For the Oak Creek...including Cornville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Cornville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flooding begins to inundate lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 8.0 feet, Flooding of lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 9.0 feet, Hiking trails along banks of creek affected. Portions of residential yards flooded. At 12.0 feet, Significant flooding of RV park near Page Springs Rd. At 17.0 feet, Inundation begins to affect fish hatchery across from gauge site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:31 PM MST Wednesday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to rise to 15.4 feet later this evening. It will fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.3 feet on 02/15/2019. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Oak Creek Cornvill 8.0 8.3 Wed 5 pm MST 6.8 4.6 4.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
